Posts.Content: I hope it was a wonderful day of looking ahead to a great life and days with your sweet kids. Ummmm cake sounds good!

How sorry I am for you. I have had dogs all my life and it just breaks your heart when they must leave us. My little doggie has been my companion too even if she is a rascal at times for sure. Time will heal the loss and lovely memories will never leave but it is so hard now for you. My eyes are in tears for you.
Posts.Title: My Beautiful Angel died

Posts.Content: How sorry I am for you. I have had dogs all my life and it just breaks your heart when they must leave us. My little doggie has been my companion too even if she is a rascal at times for sure. Time will heal the loss and lovely memories will never leave but it is so hard now for you. My eyes are in tears for you.
Posts.Title: My Beautiful Angel died

Posts.Content: I am so glad to hear from someone that feels as I do and realizes the huge advances these programs have made in many areas of our lives and especially to health issues and even things we use daily. I am a little prejudiced because I have a son who is a flight controller for the space station in the area of life support and his wife works in the heart lab for NASA --I am so proud of them so please forgive me for bragging a little on them but they are "good people" and have been so supportive of me with my BC too. These programs are in so much jeopardy now because of budget cuts and it pains me to see our nation turn its back on the sciences. Being from Houston...you are one brave lady to go out in 2F!! This place would freak out if we ever felt 2F!!! We bundle up at 50F; you would laugh at us. We are pitiful!
Posts.Title: Discovery and Space Station

Posts.Content: Fun to see someone having fun. My husband and I lived in Venezuela for about 3 years a while back and I loved the jungle--just the best birds and so on to see. Loved the Carribean too of course.
Posts.Title: new pix up

Posts.Content: Sorry the last step included pain and bruising but what a relief to say good bye too! Happy for you!
Posts.Title: I have been deported!

Posts.Content: I don't have any info on this but that photo of your family always makes me so happy--with arms all linked together. I will link on in spirit for your health.
Posts.Title: it's back again....... in my spinal fluid

Posts.Content: I could sweep cancer away from this world and take everyone on a big cruise to celebrate! I had my surgery in Houston in November and it went well. Good luck to you!
Posts.Title: Need to vent...I am so..

Posts.Content: Actually I use those caps that you can buy on line that have little ties at the back. It makes them more adjustable for me. Just type in a search engine something like Chemo caps and scarves and lots of sites will come up. Regular caps you just buy at the store seldom cover enough for me but some people put a scarf under them to make-do. Since I can sew a little bit I have actually made some of my favorite caps with little ties on them at the back or side. I made the pattern after looking at a couple I bought and realized how simple it would be to make them. PM me if you would like my self-made pattern and I can send you a copy. It only takes a little material and about a half an hour to make one. Guess you can tell I went a little head cover crazy :) but I like variety. Love from Pink.
Posts.Title: need advice on hair loss preparation

Posts.Content: I was reading and ran my hand through my hair and some came out. My hair was about midneck length and I kept enough of it through the next week so that I didn't need to wear a cap or scarf. By day 18 I decided it was time for a cap or scarf. I had a wig on hand and I am on week 6 of chemo and still haven't worn the wig so think about if you are the wig type or not. The caps and scarves are just more comfortable and secure feeling to me. I haven't shaved my head and doubt I will. Just don't care about it that much and I sort of like the little fuzz I have left. I figure those poor little hairs made it this far through all of those drugs so they can just fall out when and if they want to. We all have our own take on this. I never used a net at all.
Posts.Title: need advice on hair loss preparation

Posts.Content: Hogwarts is the perfect anology for us here. Loooking like I might be around for a while so I will learn what I can!
Posts.Title: I was asked to post this occasionally~ the start of a New Year seems like the right time for our New BC board Family Members

Posts.Content: So glad they brightened your day!
Posts.Title: thank you so much!

Posts.Content: Our dogs love us so unconditionally, they are so very hard to let go! Sweet memories will sustain you once the time comes. So sorry for you all.
Posts.Title: my dog has cancer

Posts.Content: You are such a true survivor, I looked back at your "about me" page and you have been dealing with cancer so well for so long and living your life well through so many experiences-very good ones and very sad ones. I know that with time and thought you will make the right choices again for all involved. My daughter taught Kindergarten a few years back and one of the things she always asked or reminded them of was "did you make good choices". The problem with our adult choices is that the best choice is not always as simple as a kindergarten one, is it? Prayers for you during a difficult time for you both. If his children are still there, I would take a better look after the dust settles from the visit too but you are expressing
Posts.Title: Off topic....may be my last dutch treat....sigh....

Posts.Content: Hope you can feel a big fuzzy blanket of prayer over you. I love this site because people can be just totally honest about their fears and bumps and bruises and ask for what they need and people step up with encouragement. Hugs to you!
Posts.Title: Please just say a little prayer....

Posts.Content: Hope you can feel a big fuzzy blanket of prayer over you. I love this site because people can be just totally honest about their fears and bumps and bruises and ask for what they need and people step up with encouragement. Hugs to you!
Posts.Title: Please just say a little prayer....

Posts.Content: that those dates imprint themselves forever in your memory. I can remember exactly where I was when my radiologist called back on Aug. 26th like I am looking at myself standing there. But Praise God you can post and write us 3 years later!
Posts.Title: Sunday (27th) 3 yrs since

Posts.Content: that is my radiologist who actually called with the cancer diagnosis. She had done the core biopsy and was highly suspicious and she was the one who called me first. I was in a shoe store of all places!! LOL. She asked if I was okay and had a place to sit down. I did--one of those shoe store chairs!
Posts.Title: Sunday (27th) 3 yrs since

Posts.Content: So glad that very first chemo is over. Nerves play such a part in it--that unknown factor. I just had my second chemo yesterday and I am doing well also. What a relief for us both!!!
Posts.Title: 1st chemo...the worst bit was walking thru the door!

Posts.Content: I have followed her journey through you the last few weeks and missed this post on St. Pat's day. Just had chemo #3 and it was a bit tougher so didn't log in. My prayers have been sent for the family and you.
Posts.Title: With a heavy heart..

Posts.Content: Bringing my pillow this time since chemo was Monday so I expect to crash. Best put me up front this time but I will bring chocolate chip cookies--my fav. Best of luck tomorrow too and hoping for great results!
Posts.Title: Get pet scans RESULTS in the am.... left out an important word!!!

Posts.Content: Such wonderful news! I can feel that smile just shining through the night. Way to go and enjoy every day! You have earned it.
Posts.Title: Good to Go for Another Six Months

Posts.Content: "Over" is always a good word when it refers to hospital procedures! Take care of yourself now.
Posts.Title: Thank you for Prayers from Ticky

Posts.Content: We talked a little about it and decided to go out for a nice lunch at some new restaurant--somewhere that we have never tried and skip the hassle of dinner reservations. I am so glad my sweet Dave is home with me right now and can actually eat out at lunch! He works overseas and is only home every other month so he got here in time for my first chemo and then will be here for my second one and then leaves 5 days later. He is being so sweet to me and has really stepped it up this month --we will celebrate 40 years of marriage in August. Can't believe that really! Oh funny thing...he bought me a box of chocolate covered cherries--I know, I know ..lots of people hate them but I just love them, however he hid them in the house and my little dog discovered them while we were out and ate every last one of them!!! Happy Valentine's Day to Everyone! And I agree, I want to be at Natly's!
Posts.Title: *~~~ Do You Have Any Special Plans For Valentine's Day? ~~~*

Posts.Content: in that you are doing your lab so you can have the results and then discuss all of this with your doctor. Be sure to discuss the depression issues too. It can steal your drive so that you just don't really care if you eat or not. If the Efflexor doesn't work there are many more to try. Besides Breast Cancer diagnoses, there is alot of depression and/or anxiety in my family also so I have had to learn a lot--more than I wanted to know really but you can pm me if you want. Until my bc diagnosis I was traveling to care for my mother monthly (flying over 1200 miles) so that my sister (who has depression) could have some time for herself. It did wear me out although I wanted to do it --but life was strange during that year plus. Hope the appt goes well on Thursday and this begins to be reso
